intro: Chamaesyce chalicophila, commonly known as the clustered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in desert or arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are covered in fine hairs, providing some protection against water loss. The species is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
